DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled , repeated measure study intention-to-treat involves exposure Reiki therapy placebo control intervention total six treatment , three treatment per week two week , 2-week follow-up decrease neuropathic pain extremity trauma .
DOC.detailed_description: Sixty participant randomize either receive three 30-minute standardized treatment per week two week Reiki therapy ( n=30 ) placebo intervention ( n=30 ) . All participant complete outcome measure ( Brief Pain Inventory , Neuropathic Pain Scale , Patient Global Impression Improvement Scale , Pittsburgh Quality Sleep Scale , McGill Pain Questionnaire-SF ) establish time . Any opioid analgesic requirement also collect . Aim 1 : Test efficacy 2-week course Reiki therapy pain outcome ( present , average bad pain intensity level perception pain relief Brief Pain Inventory ( BPI ) Patient Global Impression Improvement-PGI-I ) compare placebo Reiki intervention combat-injured service member major limb trauma experience neuropathic pain . Aim 2 : Examine effect 2-week course Reiki therapy compare placebo Reiki intervention quality sleep measure Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index ( PSQI ) , pain interference ( BPI ) , character quality pain ( Neuropathic Pain Scale McGill Pain Questionnaire-Short Form ) combat-injured service member major limb trauma experience neuropathic pain . Aim 3 : Describe difference pattern response Reiki therapy placebo Reiki intervention pain outcome ( pain intensity , perception relief PGI-I ) base neuropathic pain type , pain duration , presence absence diagnosis PTSD .
